snippet: An insurgent group claimed responsibility for an attack on Thursday, saying it was a response to the mass killing of unarmed civilians in Aleppo.
abstract: Insurgents in Aleppo Province, Syria, set off enormous explosion that levels the Carlton Hotel, underscoring their vow to continue the fight and their ability to carry out damaging attacks despite retreating from Homs; members of the Islamic Front, who claim responsibility for the blast, are among those who have objected to the evacuation deal on grounds that the rebels should make no compromise with the government.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: Alan Cowell contributed reporting from London, and Mohammad Ghannam from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: An insurgent group claimed responsibility for an attack on Thursday, saying it was a response to the mass killing of unarmed civilians in Aleppo.

headline.main: An Explosion and a Blockade, and a Syrian Pact Is in Limbo
headline.print_headline: An Explosion and a Blockade, and a Syrian Pact Is in Limbo

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
